definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: What parent stay for several days, moan and groan all day.
sentences.chinese: 何父住店多日，整日唉声叹气。

sentences.english: Do we just sit there, sighing and complaining about it?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们就仅仅坐在这，唉声叹气，抱怨吗？

sentences.english: Don't moan and groan because of a little setback.
sentences.chinese: 不要受了一点挫折就唉声叹气。

sentences.english: She calls me more often than usual , moaning and groaning.
sentences.chinese: 她比平常更频繁的打电话给我，唉声叹气地。

sentences.english: I loathe negativity. I can't stand people who moan.
sentences.chinese: 我厌恶消极态度，不能忍受唉声叹气的人。

sentences.english: Huang Zhankui back to spike ridge, flustered, they are not.
sentences.chinese: 黄占魁回到狼牙岭，狼狈不堪，众人也是唉声叹气。

sentences.english: Have you ever sighed over the failures?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾经因为失败而唉声叹气？

definition: long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
